answers.answer: Hi,Your symptoms may or may not be related to the prostate. Even for those with a family history, a case at 30 years old would be remarkable.The frequency in voiding urine in the night may also be a sign of diabetes (which you may consider getting a blood test for), the lower back and lower abdomen pain may be related with your exercises, your posture especially on the bike may ne contributory. Consider performing other exercises that may not be too hard on the back or the perineum (this is the area occupied by the genitalia and the anus – essentially what you sit on, I couldn’t think of any other term).Stay positive.

question: 30 yr old male, sore lower back/lower abdomen, more and more frequent urination in middle of night, discomfort sitting long periods of time, really sore after riding bicycle, sometimes have trouble getting erection & keeping one. had ct scan to check for kidney stones- came back negative. don't have much stress in my life right now. father had enlarged prostate in late 40s + 50s. any guesses?
title: sore lower back/abdomen frequent urination
